summary: The Northwest Territories (NT) is a large Canadian territory, covering about 1.1 million square kilometers. It is the second-largest and most populous of Canada's three northern territories. The capital, Yellowknife, has a population of over 20,000. NT became part of Canada in 1870 and has since been divided to create new provinces and territories. Its borders were last changed in 1999 when Nunavut was formed. NT has a unique landscape, including boreal forests, tundra, and Arctic Archipelago. It shares borders with Nunavut, Yukon, and several provinces.
title: Northwest Territories
